author: Special Correspondent
text:
As part of its efforts towards utilising green energy, the Electrical Branch of Salem Railway Division distributed energy efficient and high luminance 7 watt LED lamps to the railway employees at a subsidised rate on Tuesday.

The seven watt LED lamps are provided for Rs.100 as against the market price of Rs. 300 and it comes with a 3 years replacement warranty. The distribution of LED lamps was launched by Shubhranshu, Divisional Railway Manager, in the presence of R. S. Sinha, Additional Divisional Railway Manager, S. Rangarajan, Senior Divisional Electrical Engineer-General, and other branch officers and staff.

On an average a common incandescent lamp of 40 watt capacity lit for 12 hours would consume 14 units of electricity per month, whereas with the usage of LED bulb it would come down to 2.5 units. Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Shubhranshu commended the initiative of the Electrical General branch of Salem Division and said that every unit of electricity saved is to be deemed as that much energy produced.
title: LEDs distributed
